title.justification: The title clearly states that the focus of the paper is on learning communication-efficient optimizers.

extractions.description: This paper introduces and evaluates learned optimization approaches that improve communication efficiency in distributed training of deep learning models. By incorporating local optimizers into a meta-learning framework, the researchers propose novel architectures for learned optimizers, demonstrating their potential to outperform existing methods like local SGD in communication-efficient settings.

type.justification: The paper provides experimental results and comparisons of different optimizer implementations, indicating that it is empirical in nature.
type.quote: Our results demonstrate that local learned optimizers can substantially outperform local SGD and its sophisticated variants while maintaining their communication efficiency.

name.justification: The paper focuses on optimizing communication efficiency in deep learning training, specifically in the context of distributed optimization algorithms.
name.quote: our results outline a promising future for communication-efficient distributed learning.

name.justification: The techniques in this paper are closely related to federated learning, which also deals with communication-efficient strategies in distributed settings.
name.quote: A closely related algorithm has been proposed and extensively used in federated learning for communication efficiency.

name.justification: The learned optimizers use a meta-learning framework to develop improved optimization strategies.
name.quote: Learned optimization through meta-learning has been an increasingly important topic of research interest.

name.justification: The paper compares its proposed methods against state-of-the-art adaptive optimizers and seeks to generalize across various datasets and architectures.
name.quote: Recent works have demonstrated highly competitive performance with state-of-the-art adaptive optimization strategies

name.justification: The paper introduces LOpt-A as one of the proposed local learned optimizers.
name.quote: LOpt-A Our first proposed variant of a locally learned optimizer uses ∆t, the average of the updates from all workers, as an input feature and uses it to compute features along with the optimizer state.

is_contributed.justification: LOpt-A is newly proposed in this research paper.
is_contributed.quote: our results outline a promising future for communication-efficient distributed learning.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes empirical studies where the LOpt-A was executed.

is_compared.justification: LOpt-A is compared against other baseline models like local SGD and SlowMo.
is_compared.quote: Our LOpt-A and LAgg-A outperform strong communication-efficient baselines such as SlowMo and local SGD.
